Docs.param: The URI of the entity, or if the entity is anonymous.
Docs.summary: Constructs a new entity with the given URI.
Implicitly converts a string URI to an entity.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool op_Equality (SemWeb.Entity a, SemWeb.Entity b);

Docs.summary: Tests whether two entities are equal.

returns.para: If both parameters are , the operator returns true.
Otherwise, the operator returns true if the two entities are the same instance, or if their URIs are equal.

remarks.para: Two anonymous entities are not equal unless they are the same instance, or if they represent the same resource and were created by the same store.
Note that the class does not have an equality operator, so you must be comparing two variables typed as Entity to use this operator.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool op_Inequality (SemWeb.Entity a, SemWeb.Entity b);

Docs.summary: Tests whether two entities are not equal.
Docs.returns: The negation of the result of applying the equality operator.

Docs.summary: An entity resource in a graph, which is any node but a literal.

remarks.para: Entities can have URIs, or they can be anonymous, in which case their URI is .
Specialized stores will attach caching information to Entity objects to make interaction with the store faster. It is therefore better to reusing existing Entity objects where possible.
